comments.body: We could do tests on Windows. There one calls `ctest`.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +13,17 @@:: cmake Test.
ctest
if errorlevel 1 exit 1

:: Some OSS libraries are happier if z.lib exists, even though it's not typical on Windows.

comments.body:
> Shouldn't need the directory. Also, add `if errorlevel 1 exit 1` on the next line.

Removed the directory and added the exit error. (It is really annoying that we need to tell Windows they he is wrong when exiting.)

Yeah, but even Linus shell scripts need an option for this.  I think it is 

```
set -e
```

?  I don't know if windows has an equivalent.  Basically this practice prevents you from ever uploading half-baked packages.
Yes, it is. Would be nice if there was a `set -e` strategy for Windows. If there is one, I don't know it. Anyways, LGTM and AppVeyor is running the test available.
LOL It didn't show your comment until after I posted that @msarahan.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +13,17 @@:: cmake Test.
ctest
if errorlevel 1 exit 1

:: Some OSS libraries are happier if z.lib exists, even though it's not typical on Windows.
